matches.text: Standard detector for absolute dose measurements
Cylindrical chamber with active volume around 0.6cc
Collects charge from the ionization chamber
Converts ionization current to digital reading
Provides tissue-equivalent medium for measurements
Allows precise positioning of detectors at different depths
Measures atmospheric pressure for correction factors
Used to calculate air density corrections
Too large for accurate measurements in fields < 3×3 cm²
Suffers from significant volume averaging effects in small fields
Small, water-equivalent detector with minimal energy dependence
Synthetic diamond with extremely small sensitive volume
Excellent 2D spatial resolution, but challenging absolute calibration
Provides full planar dose distribution with sub-millimeter resolution
Small sensitive volume but requires correction for non-water equivalence
Higher sensitivity per volume but over-responds to low-energy photons
Boost to surgical scar (≤ 2 cm depth)
Practical range of approximately 2-3 cm in tissue
Boost to lymph nodes (2-3 cm depth)
Practical range of approximately 4-6 cm in tissue
Chest wall irradiation
Practical range of approximately 6-8 cm in tissue
Superficial lesions (≤ 1 cm depth)
Practical range of approximately 1.5-2 cm in tissue
Pre-treatment verification of IMRT/VMAT fields
Multiple detectors arranged in a grid for efficient verification
In-vivo dosimetry on patient skin
Small passive detectors that can be placed directly on patients
Transit dosimetry during treatment
Captures exit dose information that can be used for reconstruction
High-resolution 2D dose distribution verification
Self-developing film that changes color in proportion to absorbed dose

steps.description: Measure beam quality (PDD10/PDD20 or %dd(10)x)
steps.explanation: Determining the beam quality is the first step in the TG-51 protocol

steps.description: Set up ionization chamber at reference depth
steps.explanation: Chamber is positioned at 10 cm depth for photons in water phantom

steps.description: Take reference ionization reading
steps.explanation: Collect charge under reference conditions

steps.description: Apply temperature and pressure corrections
steps.explanation: Correct for differences from reference conditions

steps.description: Apply beam quality conversion factor kQ
steps.explanation: Account for beam quality differences from calibration quality

steps.description: Calculate absorbed dose using chamber calibration factor
steps.explanation: Determine dose to water at the reference point

proceduralBanks.title: Small Field Output Factor Measurement Steps

steps.description: Select appropriate detector based on field size
steps.explanation: Choose detector with small enough active volume

steps.description: Verify beam alignment and centering
steps.explanation: Critical for small fields where positional accuracy is paramount

steps.description: Measure detector signal in reference field (e.g., 10×10 cm²)
steps.explanation: Establish baseline under standard conditions

steps.description: Measure detector signal in small field of interest
steps.explanation: Collect reading under test conditions

steps.description: Calculate output factor as ratio of readings
steps.explanation: Determine relative output compared to reference field

steps.description: Apply appropriate small field correction factors
steps.explanation: Account for detector-specific effects in small fields

proceduralBanks.title: Electron Beam Calibration According to TG-51

steps.description: Measure PDD or depth-ionization curve
steps.explanation: Collect depth distribution data to determine beam quality

steps.description: Determine beam quality (R50) from the depth-ionization curve
steps.explanation: R50 is the depth at which the ionization is 50% of maximum

steps.description: Convert depth-ionization to depth-dose curve
steps.explanation: Apply necessary corrections to convert ionization to dose

steps.description: Place chamber at reference depth
steps.explanation: Position at depth of 0.6R50 as specified by TG-51

steps.description: Take ionization reading at reference depth
steps.explanation: Collect charge measurement under reference conditions

steps.description: Calculate dose using appropriate quality conversion factor
steps.explanation: Apply electron beam-specific factors to determine dose

steps.description: Export the patient plan to the QA phantom
steps.explanation: Transfer treatment fields to verification geometry

steps.description: Recalculate the dose distribution on the phantom
steps.explanation: Generate expected dose for comparison

steps.description: Set up the phantom and detector on the treatment couch
steps.explanation: Position verification equipment precisely

steps.description: Deliver the treatment plan to the QA phantom
steps.explanation: Irradiate the phantom with the patient's plan

steps.description: Compare measured and calculated dose distributions
steps.explanation: Analyze agreement between expected and delivered dose

steps.description: Evaluate gamma passing rates and other metrics
steps.explanation: Determine if plan meets acceptance criteria
